etymology.description: 上(上) (shàng, "to go upward; to attend") + 班(班) (bān, "shift; duty") = to go to work
etymology.interpretation: The word 上班(上班) (shàngbān, "to go to work") combines the idea of attending, as in 上(上) (shàng, "to go upward; to attend"), with a work shift or duty, as indicated by 班(班) (bān, "shift; duty"). Thus, it literally means to attend one's duty or work shift, which is understood as going to work.

examples.chinese: 我早上九点上班(我早上九點上班)。
examples.english: I go to work at nine in the morning.

examples.chinese: 他每天骑车上班(他每天騎車上班)，充满热情工作(充滿熱情工作)。
examples.pinyin: Tā měitiān qíchē shàngbān, chōngmǎn rèqíng gōngzuò.
examples.english: He rides his bike to work every day and works with great enthusiasm.

examples.chinese: 她上班前喝杯咖啡(她上班前喝杯咖啡)。
examples.pinyin: Tā shàngbān qián hē bēi kāfēi.
examples.english: She drinks a cup of coffee before going to work.
